alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 08 at 11:01AM CST until March 25 at 9:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting Pointe Coupee, West Feliciana and East Baton Rouge Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO SATURDAY, MARCH 25... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Red River Landing. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Saturday, March 25. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, Access roads will be inundated and evacuation of all river islands must be complete. Protection of people and property in the river bottom land on the river side of the levees must be complete. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 46.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 49.5 feet Saturday, March 18. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday, March 25. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 49.5 feet on 07/18/1928. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; Pointe Coupee; West Feliciana
